description: Dive into "Dubai's Ultimate Mall Adventure" — a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Dubai's Ultimate Mall Adventure

places.generalDescription: Mall of the Emirates is a renowned shopping destination in Dubai, offering over 630 stores catering to all kinds of shoppers, from luxury fashion enthusiasts to bargain hunters. The mall features international department stores like Harvey Nichols and Bloomingdales, as well as traditional Arabian shops selling spices, textiles, and handicrafts. Additionally, visitors can enjoy a wide array of dining options with over 100 restaurants.

sources.snippet: The only place in the UAE where you'll find a ski slope, Mall of the Emirates is a magnet for Middle Eastern travellers who’ve never seen snow. The mall’s Fashion District looks like the pages of Vogue brought to life, with Bulgari, Dior and Gucci stopping shoppers in their tracks with attention-grabbing window displays. High-street offerings include Next, Topshop and the popular Turkish equivalent, Koton, while Harvey Nichols and Debenhams go head to head as the flagship department stores.
sources.shortName: The best shopping in Dubai

sources.snippet: Though there are over 630 brands on offer, including fashion, sports and electronics, the Mall of the Emirates is about much more than stores. After a day of shopping, visitors can opt into the ‘Hands Free’ service, dropping their bags at designated storage areas before enjoying attractions that include an indoor ski slope and an amusement centre as well as hotels and restaurants. The shopping can then be delivered to you anywhere inside the mall, or even to your door at home.
sources.shortName: 10 Shopping Centres In Dubai

sources.snippet: The Mall of the Emirates is a one-stop-shop destination that has earned it the epithet of being the "World’s first shopping resort." It has also been named the “World's Leading New Shopping Mall”. The Mall of the Emirates is home to a magnificent family leisure center housing Ski Dubai, an indoor ski resort, and Snow Park, the first of its kind in the Middle East.Location: Sheikh Zayed Road, Al BarshaHighlights: Ski Dubai (indoor ski resort), VOX Cinemas, Magic Planet, luxury brands, and diverse dining options.
sources.shortName: 15 Malls in Dubai For the Best Shopping Experience

sources.snippet: What: Expect lashings of luxury at this 223,000 square-metre shopping and leisure ‘resort’ that also features a 14-screen cinema, the two-level Magic Planet playzone area, a swanky five-star Kempinski Hotel and the 500-seat Dubai Community Theatre & Arts Centre (DUCTAC). Opened in 1995, this all-encompassing complex is packed with spacious shopping avenues, over 85 coffee shops and restaurants and a mammoth array of boutiques and stores, including a huge Harvey Nics.
sources.shortName: Top 10 shopping malls in Dubai

sources.snippet: One of the best malls in Dubai for shopping, Mall of the Emirates stands out due to its unique combination of shopping, dining, and entertainment. With over 600 stores, including luxury brands like Alexander McQueen and high-street names like H&M, it caters to a wide range of shoppers. The mall is also home to Ski Dubai, the Middle East’s first indoor ski resort, where visitors can ski, snowboard, or simply enjoy the snowy environment in the heart of the desert.
sources.shortName: The Best Shopping Malls in Dubai

sources.snippet: Located near the Sheikh Zayed Road in the Al Barsha district, this retail paradise delivers another 630 stores, alongside 100 restaurants and cafes and even an indoor ski slope!. Stay cool skiing, snowboarding, tobogganing or meeting the penguins at the world-famous Ski Dubai, then explore luxury brands in the even cooler Fashion Dome. Dig Kate Spade, DKNY - and don’t forget the high-tech Apple boutique.
sources.shortName: Shopping Malls in Dubai | Go City®

sources.snippet: Mall of the Emirates is the first shopping resort in the world, nestled in the heart of Dubai. It covers an area of 233,467 square meters, including various categories of stores such as fashion, lifestyle, sports, home furnishing, electronics, departmental & many more. With lots of fun, sports and entertainment facilities, this huge Mall can be a perfect shopping destination for you and your family.

sources.snippet: Known as the world's first shopping resort, Mall of the Emirates has an astounding 2.4 million square feet of retail floor space. Tenants include Boutique 1, Centrepoint, Forever 21, Kate Spade New York, DKNY and an Apple store.

places.name: Mall of the Emirates

reviews.text: Mall of the Emirates is a premier shopping destination featuring a huge variety of international and local brands, from luxury labels to high street favorites. Beyond shopping, it offers excellent dining options, entertainment like Ski Dubai, and family friendly activities. The mall is spacious, clean, and well-organized, making it perfect for a full day of shopping, dining, and fun.

Great Shopping Variety with an Icy Highlight!

The Mall of the Emirates is another fantastic shopping destination in Dubai. It may not be quite as huge as The Dubai Mall, but the selection of shops is top-notch, and the mall is very clear and clean. The absolute highlight is, of course, Ski Dubai – it's just crazy to see a ski slope in the middle of the desert! A great mall that perfectly combines shopping and unique entertainment.

A well-organized and massive mall with world-class facilities. The entire space is neat, clean, and thoughtfully maintained. Car parking is superbly arranged, and there's direct access from the metro, making it very convenient.

Inside, you'll find a large food court, cinema screens, and plenty of international brands. One impressive feature is the instant cleaning service-staff are always on top of keeping the space spotless.

For easy navigation, the mall has interactive systems and even QR code scanning options, so you can navigate from your phone with ease. Overall, a top-class mall experience-highly recommended for shopping, dining, and leisure.

places.address: Sheikh Zayed Rd, Al Barsha - Al Barsha 1 - Dubai, United Arab Emirates

places.generalDescription: Dubai Mall is a massive shopping and entertainment complex, boasting department stores, an ice rink, an aquarium, and a cinema. It's the world's second-largest mall, covering 500,000 square meters and offering stunning views of the world's tallest building. The mall is a haven for luxury brand enthusiasts with its high-end fashion stores like Versace and Burberry. Located in Downtown Dubai, it's easily accessible by taxi or Metro from DXB Airport.

sources.snippet: The UAE’s highest concentration of designer boutiques can be found here, alongside the Dubai Aquarium and Underwater Zoo and an Olympic-sized ice rink, while the Dubai Fountain and Burj Khalifa are on the doorstep. Walking through the several million square feet of retail space is a workout: you can navigate with the Dubai Mall mobile app, and be sure to pack comfortable shoes – or buy a pair. With more than 1,300 shops, including anchor departments stores Galeries Lafayette and Bloomingdale’s, finding the right footwear for the job shouldn’t be a problem.
sources.shortName: The best shopping in Dubai

sources.snippet: The biggest mall in the world beat its own record in 2018 by adding an extension and getting even larger. With over 1,200 retail stores spread over an area the size of 200 football pitches, the Dubai Mall has something for everyone, from ultra-luxury outlets to high-street stores. Don’t be surprised to find there’s more than one outlet for the same brands – the mall is so vast that it might be worth hopping onto an indoor car that can take you around it.
sources.shortName: 10 Shopping Centres In Dubai

sources.snippet: As the largest mall in the world, the Dubai Mall draws in almost 100 million visitors a year. It's easy to get lost—there are more than 1,200 shops, after all—but a great place to beat the Dubai heat and ogle at the luxury stores. The place draws in more tourists from around the world than both New York City and Los Angeles so it's safe to say, everyone comes here.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Shops in Dubai

sources.snippet: not only Dubai's but the world's largest shopping centre, Dubai Mall, receives more than 750,000 visitors each week. The purpose of the visitors is not just shopping, but also skiing at the Olympic skiing court, walking at aquarium and underwater zoo (there are sharks, various kinds of mammals, small fish and a penguin flock), and taking a selfie at Dubai's live-action decoration pools and in front of the Burj Khalifa. There are five luxury hotels in the region for those who want to relax all day, which are also the perfect places for anyone tired of exploring the products of primary and popular brands all day.
sources.shortName: 10 biggest Malls in Dubai

sources.snippet: Renowned as the world’s biggest shopping mall, Dubai Mall covers 12 million square feet - that’s more than 200 soccer pitches!. So you can easily spend a day amongst its 1,200 shops, stalls and boutiques offering everything from off-the-catwalk fashion to traditional Arabic art and crafts. At its heart, a fabulous four-story waterfall gives a fresh feel so you won’t get hot and sweaty chasing down bargains at flagship stores including Alexander McQueen, Gucci, Valentino, Chanel and Ralph Lauren.
sources.shortName: Shopping Malls in Dubai | Go City®

sources.snippet: Some of the most breathtaking shopping experiences in the entire globe can be found at Dubai Mall. This enormous complex immediately rose to the top of the region's tourist attractions, drawing more than 80 million visitors a year despite not having a conventional mall layout. This upscale shopping complex, which is situated at the foot of the Burj Khalifa and the Dubai Fountain, features over 1200 shops, from upscale clothing boutiques to family-friendly amusement venues.

It also boasts the world’s largest indoor aquarium - 'Dubai Aquarium and Underwater Zoo'.

places.name: Dubai Mall

reviews.text: All the high end brands in one place. Bathrooms are exquisite for a mall. Very clean, beautiful decor and classy coffee shops. There is even a concierge at the entrance. Very upmarket.  I enjoyed the Chinese mall side as well as the aquarium as well.

More Than Just a Mall – An All-Day Experience!

The Dubai Mall is gigantic and kept us busy for the entire day. The sheer size and selection of shops are unbelievable, but it's so much more than just a shopping center. With the aquarium, the huge food court, the fountains outside, and countless other attractions, it's a perfect place for the whole family. You can easily spend a full day here without getting bored. Very clean and well-organized. A true experience!

Dubai Mall is truly impressive – the largest mall with endless shopping, dining, and entertainment options. Parking is convenient and well-organized, making visits hassle-free. The only downside during my visit was that the famous fountain show was under maintenance, otherwise it's a must-see attraction.

places.generalDescription: Dubai Festival City Mall is a sprawling shopping hub in the UAE, offering a versatile experience for visitors. With over 400 stores, it features luxury brands and mid-range options, with discounts of up to 50-70% during sales. The mall hosts elaborate shopping festivals and the renowned IMAGINE show, which includes water, light & laser displays. Visitors can enjoy various dining options, a cinema complex, and entertainment for the whole family.

sources.snippet: Known for its magnificent light shows, the Dubai Festival City Mall is deemed as one of the best shopping malls in Dubai. Opened in 2007, the name of this Dubai mall is famous among travellers and visitors for its fantastic ambience and great options for accommodation, fine dining, shopping, and entertainment. Speaking of accommodation options, it has renowned hotels like InterContinental Residence Suites, Crowne Plaza Dubai Festival City, InterContinental Dubai Festival City, and Holiday Inn Dubai Festival City.

reviews.text:
I just wanted to say how much we enjoyed our visit to Dennis Restaurant! The food was absolutely delicious, and the service made it even better.

A special thank you to Mario, who was incredibly kind, attentive, and accommodating throughout our meal. He made us feel very welcome, and his service truly elevated our experience.

My boyfriend and I had a great time  we'll definitely be coming back again. Keep up the great work, Mario!

This is a pretty good mall in terms of  stores, architecture, and customer needs. reviews.text: In a great location & has a visible city sightseeing stop right out front. Spent good bit of time at this mall during my time in Dubai. Free “rooftop” views in the food court which is a major plus to visiting! Has a movie theatre for those looking to see new movies, many store options and several food options. Really happy with this mall. Well AC to compete with the hot weather.

Dubai Marina Mall is one of those hidden gems that blends charm with convenience. It may not be the biggest mall in Dubai, but that's actually part of what makes it so enjoyable - it has a cozy, open layout with beautiful indoor spaces and waterfront views just outside.

What really sets Marina Mall apart is the variety and uniqueness of its shops. Unlike the larger malls that tend to repeat the same big-name brands, this one mixes well-known labels with smaller boutique-style stores, giving you a more interesting shopping experience. Whether you're looking for fashion, gifts, or even just a relaxing coffee spot, you'll find something different here.

It's never overwhelmingly busy, and that calm vibe adds a lot to the experience. Great place for a peaceful walk, quality shopping, or a relaxed meal by the marina. Definitely worth visiting if you're in the area or looking for something a little more refined and easygoing than the massive retail hubs.

While Marina Mall doesn't reflect Dubai's overall image, it's a shopping mall that reflects the tastes of the wealthy. You can find branches of all brands and brands here, but the prices are exorbitant. Naturally, it reflects the lifestyle of the wealthy. The mall is so large that it's impossible to explore it all in a single day. One of my favorite features was the ice rink in such a hot city. While the rink was crowded, it was still enjoyable to watch. The downside: everything in the food court is inspired by Indian cuisine, so everything is overly spicy, which made me very uncomfortable. I couldn't find anything that didn't smell or taste strange, and that I could eat with confidence. The mall was the cleanest and largest shopping mall I've ever seen.  It was truly an Arabian Paradise. It was incredibly crowded. There were so many Asian and Indian vendors. Frankly, most of them couldn't even understand English. The Asians weren't very friendly. The mall's location is perfect, and when you leave the mall, be prepared to see luxury cars. Everyone traveling to Dubai should definitely visit the Dubai Marina Mall.

reviews.text: BurJuman is a great shopping destination with a mix of high-end and popular brands. The mall offers a wide variety of retail stores, from fashion and accessories to electronics and home goods. There are also plenty of dining options, including cafes and restaurants, making it a convenient place to spend the day. The mall's layout is easy to navigate, and the overall atmosphere is pleasant and welcoming.

BurJuman Mall isn't just a mall, it's an experience that keeps surprising me every time I visit. From the moment you walk in, the vibe is different: spacious, vibrant, and yet somehow relaxing. It's the kind of place where you can shop, dine, or simply wander and still feel like you've made the most of your time.

The variety here is what makes it special. You'll find everything, high-end fashion, daily essentials, quirky little stores, and restaurants that make you pause and think, “Should I try this today?” The food court alone feels like a mini world tour of cuisines.

What I love most, though, is how effortless it all feels. The direct metro access, smooth parking, and clean, well-maintained interiors make visiting a breeze. It's rare to find a mall that combines convenience with such a welcoming atmosphere.

For me, BurJuman Mall is more than just a shopping spot, it's where you go when you want a mix of fun, comfort, and a little bit of discovery. Without hesitation, it's a 5-star place that always leaves you curious for the next visit.

This is a 1 stop shop with plenty of shopping, multiplex cinema, food court, snacks and drinks are spread out throughout the mall & if you have kids they will enjoy the magic planet which has something for every age! The food court has cuisine from around the world and also has an international food chain such as Papa Jones, McDonald, Burger King, and KFC, to name a few.
This mall is at very close proximity to the old Dubai, so if you are doing a guided or self tour around the old Dubai, this is a good option to stop by for some shopping and food.

places.generalDescription: Ibn Battuta Mall is a remarkable shopping destination that pays homage to the legendary 14th-century explorer, Ibn Battuta. This expansive mall spans an impressive 300,000 square feet and features six distinct country-themed courts, with the Persian Court standing out due to its stunning hand-painted dome. Visitors can indulge in a diverse array of experiences here, from exploring numerous lifestyle and department stores to savoring culinary delights at over 50 restaurants and eateries.

sources.snippet: Named after the 21-year-old Moroccan man who ventured around the globe in 1335, it consists of six courts designed after the places he visited: China, India, Egypt, Tunisia, Andalusia and Persia. Though each court features elaborate local designs – Persian rugs in one section and Spanish tiles in another – the shops host fairly universal brands, too, including the likes of H&M, Jashanmal, Cath Kidston and House of Leather. Located centrally on Sheikh Zayed Road, it’s a more local option and a good choice if you’d like to shop in Dubai and avoid the crowds.

reviews.text:
Ibn Battuta Mall stands out as one of the most amazing malls in Dubai, offering an experience that goes beyond just shopping. The architectural design is stunning, with each section dedicated to a different country, creating a unique and immersive atmosphere. Walking through the mall feels like taking a trip around the world, with each area perfectly capturing the essence and vibe of its respective country.

Our visit was made even more memorable by the great time we had at Switch Bowling. It's a fantastic spot for some fun and friendly competition. The overall experience at Ibn Battuta Mall was truly "wow," and I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a memorable day out in Dubai. Whether you're there for the shopping, the entertainment, or simply to soak in the incredible ambiance, Ibn Battuta Mall is a must-visit destination.

Truly one of a kind – the architecture and interior design are marvelous. Every section of the mall is themed beautifully, and walking through feels more like a cultural journey than just a shopping trip. Each court has its unique charm, making the whole place eye-catching and worth exploring.

The variety of shops is impressive, from high-end brands to everyday essentials, and the dining options are just as diverse with plenty of cafés and restaurants to choose from. The cinema here is also a plus for entertainment after shopping.

The mall is huge, and sometimes it takes a lot of walking to get from one end to another. Clearer signboards and a bit more seating areas in between would make the experience even better.

Ibn Battuta Mall is one of the most unique malls I've visited! Each section is themed after a different country-like China, India, Egypt, and Persia-and the interiors are absolutely stunning. You feel like you're traveling the world as you walk through. The designs, architecture, and decorations in each area are so detailed and beautiful-it's not just a shopping trip, it's an experience.

The mall has a great mix of shops, cafes, and restaurants, plus a huge cinema and fun activities for kids. What I loved most is how easy it is to get there. It's directly connected to the Ibn Battuta Metro Station and also served by buses, so it's very convenient if you're using public transport.

Whether you're shopping, sightseeing, or just looking for a cool indoor place to explore in Dubai, Ibn Battuta Mall is definitely worth a visit. It's relaxing, exciting, and full of surprises around every corner!

reviews.text:
One of the best location in the whole
of UAE to experience the culture of Dubai, while this place blending the tradition very well with a modern touch.

The design resembles the old Souk, captures the rich culture and heritage aptly, with breathtaking views of the famous Burj Al Arab in the background. Place also offers amazing culinary experience with plenty of dining options offering multi cuisine restaurants which are open till late mid night.

Plenty of kids activities, swings , boat rides on dhow and entertainment for all age groups.

Over all, it's an excellent location for tourists and also local residents to spend quality time.

Plenty of paid basement parking and the same can be validated at restaurants while dining in.

Souk Madinat Jumeirah is a truly charming and unique place – it blends the atmosphere of a traditional Arabian market with a modern, elegant setting. The canals, the view of the Burj Al Arab, the lovely shops, and the restaurants all add to a magical experience.

The stores are full of beautiful souvenirs, handicrafts, and special gift items – even just strolling around is a pleasure.

The only downside worth mentioning is that prices are clearly aimed at tourists, and many items are quite overpriced. It's a good idea to shop around or compare prices elsewhere before buying.

That said, it's absolutely worth a visit – the atmosphere is one-of-a-kind, and it's a great spot for a relaxed walk or a memorable dinner.

Souk Madinat Jumeirah is such a beautiful and atmospheric place! The traditional-style architecture, canals, and charming shops make it a unique spot to wander and enjoy. I even tried camel milk ice cream here, which was a fun and special experience. It's definitely more than just a market - it's a must-visit place for anyone who wants a taste of old-meets-new Dubai.

sources.snippet: It may not be as grandiose as its big sisters, but it has two things that the others don’t have:  Depachika  and  Trèsind Studio. Depachika is a foodie haven with gourmet goodies and hard-to-find additions to your pantry, while Trésind Studio is one of the most innovative, fine dining restaurants in Dubai, and comes with not one, but two well-deserved Michelin stars. Along with its beautiful views of the city from the terrace,  Chef Himanshu, the captain of the Trèsind ship and the creative talent behind everything you taste on the plate, has turned the outdoor space into a rare, rooftop garden with fresh herbs, vegetables, edible flowers, and sunflowers growing en masse for a unique ‘farm-to-table’ experience.

reviews.text: Souk Al Bahar is a truly enchanting destination in Dubai, offering a blend of traditional Arabesque architecture with modern elegance. The souk is home to over 100 shops and 22 restaurants, providing a diverse dining experience with stunning views of the Dubai Fountain. The ambiance is serene, making it an ideal spot for both relaxation and entertainment. Visitors can enjoy a variety of cuisines, from Thai to Cuban, and take in the breathtaking views of the Burj Khalifa. Overall, Souk Al Bahar is a must-visit for its unique blend of culture, dining, and scenic beauty

Souk Al Bahar, located in Downtown Dubai near Burj Khalifa and The Dubai Mall, is a charming Arabian-style marketplace blending traditional architecture with modern luxury. It features a mix of high-end boutiques, souvenir shops, and artisan stores, offering everything from jewelry and carpets to perfumes and handicrafts.

You can enjoy top restaurants dining experience like Time Out Market, Abd El Wahab, and Karma Kafé, many of which offer stunning views of the Dubai Fountain.  Its beautiful waterfront setting and cultural appeal make it a must-visit for shoppers and food lovers in Dubai.

Souk Al Bahar is a vibrant, modern marketplace located in the heart of Downtown Dubai, directly adjacent to the famous Dubai Mall. Its architecture takes inspiration from traditional Arabic souks, but with a contemporary twist, offering a unique shopping and dining experience.

Key Activities and Attractions:

1. Shopping: The souk features an array of boutique shops offering luxury goods, jewelry, fashion, and accessories, often with an Arabian flair. It's a great place for finding unique and high-quality items.

2. Dining: Souk Al Bahar boasts several upscale restaurants and cafes that offer both international and Middle Eastern cuisine. Many have outdoor terraces with stunning views of the Dubai Fountain and the Burj Khalifa.

3. The Dubai Fountain: Right outside, you can enjoy a spectacular view of the Dubai Fountain, which puts on regular water and light shows in front of the Burj Khalifa, the tallest building in the world.

4. Water Activities: Visitors can also enjoy a traditional "abra" boat ride across the man-made lake, giving a relaxing experience and scenic views of the surrounding area.

5. Cultural Ambiance: With its Arabic-style design and beautiful walkways, Souk Al Bahar offers a blend of modern luxury and traditional charm, making it a great place for leisurely strolls.

Overall Experience:

Souk Al Bahar provides a mix of shopping, dining, and entertainment with a touch of Arabian heritage, making it a perfect stop for visitors exploring the Dubai Mall and the surrounding attractions. It's less hectic than the larger Dubai Mall, but still offers plenty to do.

reviews.text:
A Magnificent Retail Destination: Al Ghurair Centre

During my stay at the Swissôtel Al Ghurair, I had the pleasure of visiting Al Ghurair Centre, a truly magnificent and expansive shopping mall. As the first modern shopping mall in the Middle East, Al Ghurair Centre holds a significant place in Dubai's history. Established in 1981 in Dubai's Deira district, it has grown to become a premier destination for both locals and tourists, seamlessly blending a rich heritage with contemporary offerings. In 2013, Al Ghurair Centre underwent a significant expansion, enhancing the visitor experience with the addition of 150 new stores, a world-class entertainment center, popular dining concepts, 60,000 square feet of office space, a serviced apartment complex, and a 5-star hotel with direct access to the center.

Al Ghurair Centre boasts an impressive array of features, offering a comprehensive experience that extends beyond mere shopping. The mall is home to over 250 retail brands, providing an unparalleled shopping journey with a diverse selection of fashion, electronics, and home goods. Dining is a delight with more than 50 restaurants, including a dedicated Dining District and Food Court, catering to a wide range of culinary preferences, from international cuisine to Middle Eastern delights.

For entertainment, Al Ghurair Centre offers a state-of-the-art cinema with 18 screens, perfect for movie enthusiasts. Families can also enjoy attractions like Sparky's, which features an indoor skating rink, a roller coaster, and other exciting activities. Additionally, the mall features a captivating water show with a triple burst jet, adding a touch of spectacle and visual appeal. Al Ghurair Centre is truly a one-stop destination, and I highly recommend it to anyone visiting Dubai.

I recently visited Al Ghurair Mall and had a genuinely pleasant experience. Although the parking lot was quite crowded at first and it took some time to find a spot, we eventually managed to park. I was expecting the mall itself to be packed, but to my surprise, it wasn't.

The layout of the mall is well thought out-shops are neatly arranged, and there's enough space to keep the crowd flowing smoothly, with no congestion in any area. The wide variety of stores and food stalls makes it an excellent spot to visit and enjoy with your family.

Overall, it's a well-maintained and enjoyable place to spend a few hours. I'd definitely recommend it for a relaxed family outings

This is one of the oldest Malls of Dubai. A few years back it was redeveloped and turned into a more fashionable and modern mall with much more options of shopping dining and fun. I visited the new food hall which is lovely with many food stalls - which are not easily found in the city.

places.name: Dubai Outlet Mall

reviews.text:
Dubai Outlet Mall is a true treasure trove for anyone who loves shopping and chasing a great deal. Packed with dozens of brand-name shops, it offers everything from fashion and shoes to accessories, home goods, and sportswear - all at discounted prices.

What makes it exciting is that you never know what you'll find. On any given visit, you might stumble upon incredible clearance offers or “throwaway prices” where items are sold at a fraction of their original value - but only if you're lucky! It's this element of surprise that keeps visitors coming back, hunting for that perfect deal or a hidden gem on the racks.

Whether you're shopping for designer brands at lower prices, updating your wardrobe, or just browsing, Dubai Outlet Mall delivers an experience that's both fun and rewarding. Make sure you check their seasonal offers and clearance sales - you might walk away with bags full of bargains you didn't even plan for!

If you love shopping with a thrill, this is the place to visit. Just remember: go with time, patience, and a bit of luck, and you'll likely score some of the best deals in Dubai.

An amazing place if you are looking for high end brands at a fraction of the price.
The mall recently had renovations as well & added more brands which is good especially for tourists who are looking for good deals.
Recently added a Lulu supermarket as well.
The food court is a bit lacklustre though, they could do with more options.

🛍️ Dubai Outlet Mall – Discounted Brands, Limited Variety 🛍️

Dubai Outlet Mall is a decent option if you're looking to purchase branded items at discounted prices. Most of the major brands like Nike, Puma, Balmain, and many more have their showrooms here, offering 60% to 70% discounts on various products.

However, many of the items are from older collections, and the variety is limited compared to other malls. So, while you might get a good deal, you may need to spend some time to find something you truly like.

✅ Facilities available:

Spacious parking

Food court and cafeterias

Clean and hygienic washrooms

🔄 My overall experience was average-good for budget shopping, but don't expect the latest trends.

⭐ Rating: 3/5

places.generalDescription: The Dubai Gold Souk is a vibrant marketplace marked by a wooden arch, offering a dazzling array of gold jewelry and precious metals. Visitors can wander through narrow alleyways lined with gleaming storefronts, each showcasing exquisite collections of jewelry and unique souvenirs. Haggling with friendly merchants is part of the experience, as every piece tells a story of Dubai's rich cultural heritage.

sources.snippet: The mesmerising Dubai Gold Souk on the banks of Dubai Creek is undoubtedly one of the most famous attractions in Dubai, with millions of visitors each year browsing the 380 stalls and stores selling every item of jewellery imaginable. As with most markets in Dubai, haggling is expected, but as Dubai has few taxes and is a major centre for the international gold trade, prices usually match the global standard. Windows filled with rows of shimmering gold necklaces, bangles and rings sit side by side with diamond merchants and expert silversmiths in the narrow alleyways.
sources.shortName: 10 Shopping Centres In Dubai

places.name: Dubai Gold Souk

reviews.text:
Visiting the Gold Souk in Dubai was an unforgettable experience. The variety of gold jewelry on display is absolutely stunning, everything from delicate chains to bold, intricate bridal sets. It truly lives up to Dubai's title as the “City of Gold.”

The prices are fair if you know how to negotiate, and most shops are willing to bargain, especially for making charges. I appreciate that the gold quality is government-regulated, which gives peace of mind when making a purchase.

The place can get crowded and a bit overwhelming, especially with some street vendors trying to sell fake watches or perfumes, but if you stick to the licensed shops, you'll be fine. Also, it's best to check the gold price before you go and bring cash for better deals.

Overall, it's a must-visit for anyone who loves jewelry or wants to experience a vibrant part of Dubai's culture. I'll definitely come back!

The Gold Souk in Dubai is a dazzling experience -endless rows of shops glittering with beautiful gold, intricate designs, and a variety of choices for every budget. It truly captures the essence of Dubai's rich trade culture. The atmosphere is lively, and the craftsmanship is impressive.The only downside is that it can get quite crowded, especially in the evenings, making it a bit hard to browse comfortably. Still, it's an unforgettable stop in Dubai!  .

This place blown my mind!! I never seen a lot of gold just hanging in the displays. Its surreal!!
Lot of shops with tons of gold ! Beautiful designs for all kinds of types. Prices are fair and quality excellent. When in Dubai make sure you visit this place ! Just go loaded 💵💶💰🤑

places.name: Arabian Center

reviews.text: I prefer this mall because it's always quiet, clean, and comfortable, making it a pleasant place to spend time with family. The food court is spacious, and you can easily find a table even on busy weekends. They also organize engaging weekend activities that include giving gifts and fun surprises to kids, making it an enjoyable experience for families with children.

Arabian Center's services leave a lot to be desired. The customer service team is clueless and entirely reliant on their back-office teams, like marketing or others, to get anything done. If you visit after office hours, you might as well not bother-there's absolutely no chance of getting any solutions.

Their marketing is poorly handled and raises serious concerns about transparency and genuineness. The lack of coordination and professionalism makes the entire experience frustrating and untrustworthy. It feels like there's something fishy about how they operate, and as a customer, you're left questioning their credibility.

Definitely not a place I would recommend unless they make significant improvements.
Nice place for shopping and entertainment. Some times parking is full but vallet parking is available. Good to go here with family and friends.

Visitors can explore an impressive selection of unique designs, often tailored to individual tastes through custom creations by skilled artisans.

sources.snippet: Anyone serious about buying gold and precious stones in Dubai should skip the touristy gold souk and join the locals at the Dubai Gold and Diamond Park. All gems and metals are certified, so you can splurge knowing your bling has been ethically sourced.

I have visited Grace Diamonds to find the gift for my friend's baby. Mr. Vicky was very helpful. Helped me to choose perfect creation. Also I have learned interesting facts about diamonds, about the stone which suits my zodiac sign.
The hospitality was on a high level.
Also big thank you to Nikhil for the help.

Visited this place after reading reviews, but i will give the reality.
1. There are mostly gems n diamonds. There are a lot of good designs and collections.
2. Gold collection is very limited and very hard to find 22k.
3. Do not forget to visit all the shops and take the best rate and check all the collections.
4. Do all the calculations by yourself on your phone as well, sometimes its not what they write like the snapshot i added. The shopkeeper, after all the calculations, gave me 10850. But when i did calculations on my mobile, i got 10460. Upon asking, we did the calculations together, and we got 10460. And then the best thing he came up with was that it was a typo, a typo! We ended up buying from another shop.
5. The best thing is that shopkeepers are not pushy, and they give all the time needed to make the sale.

places.name: Oasis Mall

reviews.text:
#Oasis_Mall_Dubai – A Compact Shopping Destination

Oasis Mall, located on Sheikh Zayed Road, is a convenient and family-friendly shopping destination in Dubai. With a well-curated selection of stores, it caters to diverse shopping needs, including fashion, homeware, electronics, and beauty. The mall also features a variety of dining options, a play area for kids, and a fitness center. Its manageable size makes it an ideal choice for quick shopping trips or relaxed outings. Offering a blend of convenience, quality, and comfort, Oasis Mall is a favorite for both residents and visitors seeking a hassle-free shopping experience.

Oasis Mall is truly a hidden gem in Dubai. It's never too crowded, making shopping much more relaxed compared to larger malls. You'll find a good mix of popular stores, great deals, and even some unique shops. One big plus: parking is currently unlimited in time, which makes visits stress-free and convenient. A great spot for those who prefer a quieter, more comfortable shopping experience.

Oasis Mall in Dubai, offers a relaxed and convenient shopping experience. The mall houses a variety of mid-range brands, including Max, Centrepoint, catering to diverse shopping needs. Oasis Mall is ideal for those seeking a hassle-free shopping experience away from the city's busier malls. Its range of stores and amenities make it a convenient choice for everyday needs.

places.generalDescription: Bur Dubai Souk Market is a vibrant waterfront bazaar offering a wide array of goods, from textiles and attire to lighting, purses, and snacks. It's the perfect place to find specific types of fabric in various textures and colors. The market is open daily from 10 am to 10:30 pm, with evenings being the best time to visit due to cooler temperatures. Visitors can enjoy the bustling atmosphere and capture Instagram-worthy shots while exploring this quintessential Dubai attraction.

sources.snippet: Souk Market is the place to go if you want to see Dubai's biggest mall. It may be found as a huge retail complex with upscale clothing stores, restaurants, a movie theater, and an aquarium. You can also find an ice cream rink over here.
sources.shortName: Shopping in Dubai 2024: 10 Best Shopping Malls in Dubai for Shopaholics

places.name: Grand Souk - Bur Dubai

reviews.text:
A must-visit spot for anyone exploring old Dubai! Grand Souk Bur Dubai is full of character, history, and charm. The narrow alleys are lined with shops offering everything from spices, perfumes, and textiles to souvenirs, traditional clothes, and handicrafts. The sellers are friendly and open to bargaining, so don't be shy to negotiate prices.

It's a great place to experience the local culture and pick up some authentic gifts. The atmosphere is lively, especially in the evenings. It's right next to the Dubai Creek, so you can also hop on an abra (traditional boat) to Deira Souk, which adds to the experience.

Be prepared for a bit of hustle, but that's part of the charm. Definitely worth a visit if you're in Dubai!

Grand Souk Bur Dubai is a hidden gem.

The place feels vintage and real, not commercial or rushed.

Streets are narrow, shops are packed with old charm spices, fabrics, souvenirs, antiques.

It's calm compared to other markets. You can walk, explore, and shop without pressure.

Perfect spot to find unique gifts or local items.

The sellers are friendly and open to bargaining.

Great for quiet shopping, taking photos, or just soaking in the old Dubai feel.

If you like culture and calm, this is your place.🤍
This place was so exciting. The vendors are pushy but not forceful. Get your saffron here for super cheap. Make sure to get a refreshing Cane or mint lemonade juice. They were so refreshing.

places.generalDescription: Boxpark by Dubai Retail is a vibrant and contemporary outdoor shopping destination that beautifully blends retail, dining, and entertainment. Nestled between Al Wasl and Jumeirah in Dubai's Business Bay, this unique complex features an array of boutiques housed within colorful shipping containers, creating a visually striking atmosphere. With 14 distinct retail concept stores to explore, shoppers can find trendy souvenirs while enjoying the artistic architecture that defines the space.

sources.snippet: Walk between small shops on the street of this outdoor shopping centre located between Al Wasl and Jumeirah in Dubai’s Business Bay. The vibrant industrial complex, made out of colourful shipping containers, is the perfect place to get a trendy souvenir, with 14 retail concept stores. If it’s possible to tire of shopping, there are 30 dining outlets to choose from, as well as a cinema and lots of events to keep visitors entertained throughout the year.
sources.shortName: 10 Shopping Centres In Dubai
The best shopping in Dubai

places.name: Boxpark by Dubai Retail

📦 Boxpark – Urban, Creative, and Full of Vibes

Boxpark by Dubai Retail is a trendy outdoor destination made of repurposed shipping containers, offering a unique blend of street-style fashion, quirky cafés, global eateries, and bold design. Perfect for a casual hangout, photos, or exploring something different in Dubai.

📍Located on Al Wasl Road – ideal for creatives, foodies, and urban explorers.

Boxpark is such a cool and vibrant place to hang out!

places.name: The Springs Souk

reviews.text:
The Springs Souk Mall is a convenient neighborhood springs/meadow for residents in and around. It's not a large mall and aiming to serve the community only, but it covers most daily needs quite well. There's a Carrefour for groceries, a few fashion and lifestyle stores like Miniso and Typo, and a mix of casual dining options and ice cream offers.

The atmosphere is generally quiet and relaxed, which makes it a comfortable place to grab a coffee or work. The cinema is a nice addition for families, and there are a few entertainment options for kids as well.

Parking is usually easy only weekends are quite busy, and the mall is pretty new and well-maintained. It serves its purpose well for nearby residents looking for convenience without the crowds.

My kids likes walking around in the mall and its quite safe and clean.

The mall is not very big, but it's nice and well-organized. There are some good shops, things for kids, a cinema, and a Carrefour for grocery shopping.

The atmosphere is calm and not crowded, which makes it comfortable for family visits. There's also a place that sells pets and birds, and they offer services for cleaning and taking care of them - something unique you don't find in every mall.

I recommend visiting it if you like quiet, family-friendly places
it is amazing place with different indoor and outdoor shopping places. it has different restaurants, shops , play areas for kids, Cinemax etc

sources.snippet: Next on our list of famous malls in Dubai is the Century Mall. The Dubai shopping mall is located in the Al Mamzar area next to the Al Shahab Club. Managed by the Al Safeer Group of Companies, Century Mall is home to 75 speciality stores across a whopping 150,000 sq.

places.name: Century Mall

reviews.text: Pleasant experience overall. My toddler loved the newly-renovated fun city. Wide variety of food selection as well.

I recently visited Century Mall and had an enjoyable experience. The mall has a great variety of stores, from well-known brands to local shops, making it ideal for a range of shopping preferences. The layout is easy to navigate, and the atmosphere is lively yet comfortable, which made for a relaxed browsing experience.

One thing I especially appreciated was the cleanliness and upkeep of the mall; it felt well-maintained and inviting. The food court offered a good selection of cuisines, and I found a cozy spot to enjoy a meal. Additionally, the entertainment options, including a movie theater and fun activity areas, seemed perfect for family outings or hanging out with friends.

Overall, Century Mall provides a balanced mix of shopping, dining, and entertainment, making it a great spot for a day out. Looking forward to visiting again soon!
“Rabo Restaurant is where beautiful ambiance meets delightful, nostalgic flavors. A warm and cozy space with kind and friendly staff, creating a truly unique and unforgettable experience.”

sources.snippet: ARTE – the Maker’s Market, so-called because the market is the premier location for Dubai’s creatives to market themselves and sell their products – takes place every Friday in different locations across the emirate. The market was started over a decade ago by Miriam Walsh to give artisans somewhere to sell their wares, and it has become one of Dubai’s most popular markets. Creators sell different types of paintings, handicrafts and baked goods – breads, pastries and cakes – and there are regular themed weeks.
sources.shortName: 10 Shopping Centres In Dubai

places.name: ARTE Fine Art Cakes & Coffee Shop - Dubai Mall

reviews.text:
Hands down the best coffee shop in Dubai Mall! Exceptional brews, rich flavors,
The desserts here are just as impressive as the coffee! From rich, decadent cakes to perfectly flaky pastries, each treat is a delight. Freshly made and beautifully presented, Whether you're craving something sweet or just looking to indulge, the dessert selection is a standout.

I highly recommend the Black truffle dessert! It's a decadent masterpiece with a rich,Each bite melts in your mouth with truffle flavor, making it an absolute must-try. it's a heavenly experience!

A specially shout out for JANE She's attentive, friendly, and always has great suggestions. Her service truly enhances the experience, making you feel welcome and valued.

The worst coffee and croissant shop experience ever. The sweets tasted overly sugary and felt almost poisonous-definitely not safe if you care about your health. If you're looking to skyrocket your sugar levels, this is the place to visit. While the ambiance and lighting are great for photos, the food is absolutely terrible for your stomach. Would not recommend!

Aesthetic cafe located in Dubai mall. Arte Cafe offers a variety of sweet bakery and cakes each uniquely crafted as a work of art. They also offer delicious coffees such as Matcha and spanish latte. The atmosphere was exceptional andJane gave us excellent service making our experience even greater

places.generalDescription: Located in Dubai, Times Square Center is a charming mall with a welcoming atmosphere and a variety of unique stores. It features an atrium filled with palm trees and offers an array of shopping options including electronics, lifestyle products, toys, and vintage Indian furniture. Visitors can explore the Adventure Zone for thrilling activities like climbing walls and airparks.

sources.snippet: Times Square Centre may not be one of the most popular shopping malls in Dubai, but it has gained a loyal following for its warm and homely vibe, with a range of unique stores, entertainment activities and regular artisan markets. You’ll find Sharaf DG’s massive flagship store at Times Square Centre, as well as unique finds like Antika, which sells the beautiful vintage Indian furniture and Creativa Middle East, which specialises in arts and crafts supplies. For fun, head to the Adventure Zone where climbing walls and airparks will get your adrenaline pumping.
